title: How to Make Healthy, Low Cal Parmesan Crackers
category_hierarchy: Crackers and Savory Cookies and Biscuits

steps.headline: Prepare at least a cup of grated Parmesan cheese.
steps.description: Grate your own or buy it pre-grated in a package (see Tips below). The cheaper Parmesan cheese tends to produce a crisper cracker and will store better.

steps.headline: Line the baking sheet with parchment paper.
steps.description: Don't overlook the parchment paper––it's an essential requirement. Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.

steps.headline: Use a spoon to create a rounded teaspoon of cheese for each cracker.
steps.description: You may fit up to 5 of these across the baking sheet, and four rows, for 20 crackers per sheet. If possible, it's a good idea to make a huge quantity of these, so that you can freeze a lot and eat a lot!

steps.headline: Nudge any stray pieces of cheese onto a neighboring mound.
steps.description: As you place the cheese on the baking sheet make sure all cheese is placed together. Note that after baking, stray pieces they can be saved and eaten or sprinkled on or in something or given to the dog as a snack

steps.headline: Place crackers in the oven to bake.
steps.description: Put the baking sheet(s) on the upper shelves and bake for 5 to 12 minutes or until brown around the edge. If you like it really crisp, bake until the entire cracker is brown.

steps.headline: Remove the baking sheets from the oven.
steps.description: Let cool if you like, for a few minutes. However, you can remove the crackers immediately if you are in a hurry. Remove with a metal spatula––put on a plate until the next batch is out of the oven.

steps.headline: Transfer the crackers to a container.
Put more cheese on cookie sheet if you are baking more––and why not make more?
steps.description: They are low-cal alternatives to cookies, a great snack, and a healthy addiction. That's all there is to this!

text: Prepare at least a cup of grated Parmesan cheese. Grate your own or buy it pre-grated in a package (see Tips below). The cheaper Parmesan cheese tends to produce a crisper cracker and will store better. Line the baking sheet with parchment paper. Don't overlook the parchment paper––it's an essential requirement. Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Use a spoon to create a rounded teaspoon of cheese for each cracker. You may fit up to 5 of these across the baking sheet, and four rows, for 20 crackers per sheet. If possible, it's a good idea to make a huge quantity of these, so that you can freeze a lot and eat a lot! Nudge any stray pieces of cheese onto a neighboring mound. As you place the cheese on the baking sheet make sure all cheese is placed together. Note that after baking, stray pieces they can be saved and eaten or sprinkled on or in something or given to the dog as a snack Place crackers in the oven to bake. Put the baking sheet(s) on the upper shelves and bake for 5 to 12 minutes or until brown around the edge. If you like it really crisp, bake until the entire cracker is brown. Remove the baking sheets from the oven. Let cool if you like, for a few minutes. However, you can remove the crackers immediately if you are in a hurry. Remove with a metal spatula––put on a plate until the next batch is out of the oven. Transfer the crackers to a container.  Put more cheese on cookie sheet if you are baking more––and why not make more? They are low-cal alternatives to cookies, a great snack, and a healthy addiction. That's all there is to this!
